Home > Scripts > external > rgb > rgb.m

rgb

PURPOSE

rgb.m: translates a colour from multiple formats into matlab colour format

SYNOPSIS

function out=rgb(in)

DESCRIPTION 

 rgb.m: translates a colour from multiple formats into matlab colour format
 type 'rgb demo' to get started

 [matlabcolor]=rgb(col)
 matlab colors are in the format [R G B]

 if 'col' is a string, it is interpreted as

     [[modifier] descriptor] colour_name

 where
        modifier is one of   (slightly, normal, very, extremely)
        descriptor is one of (light/pale, normal, dark)
        colorname is a name of a colour
            (type 'rgb list' or 'rgb demo' to see them all)

 if 'col' is an integer between 0 and &HFFFFFF inclusive,
 it is interpreted as a double word RGB value in the form
 [0][R][G][B]

 if 'col' is a negative integer between -1 and -&HFFFFFF
 inclusive, it is interpreted as the complement of a double
 word RGB value in the form [0][B][G][R]

 if 'col' is a string of the form 'qbX' or 'qbXX' where X
 is a digit then the number part is interpreted as a qbasic
 color

 if 'col' is one of {k,w,r,g,b,y,m,c} a sensible result is
 returned

 if 'col' is already in matlab format, it is unchanged

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
  • rgb rgb.m: translates a colour from multiple formats into matlab colour format
This function is called by:
  • rgb rgb.m: translates a colour from multiple formats into matlab colour format

0040 function out=rgb(in)
0041 
0042 if isa(in,'char') & length(in)>2 & length(in)<5 & strcmpi('qb',in(1:2))
0043     out=qbcolor(sscanf(in(3:end),'%i'));
0044 elseif isa(in,'char') & length(in)==1
0045     out=translatecolorchar(in);
0046 elseif isa(in,'char')
0047     if strcmp(in,'demo') rgb_demo; return; end
0048     if strcmp(in,'list') rgb_list; return; end
0049     out=translatecolorstring(in);
0050 elseif isa(in,'double') & size(in,1)==1 & size(in,2)==1 & abs(in)<16777216
0051     out=translatecolorRGB(in);
0052 elseif isa(in,'double') & size(in,1)==1 & size(in,2)==3
0053     out=in;
0054 else
0055     warning('Unrecognised color format, black assumed');
0056     out=[0 0 0];
0057 end
0058 
0059 function out=translatecolorchar(in)
0060 switch(in)
0061 case 'k', out=[0 0 0];
0062 case 'w', out=[1 1 1];
0063 case 'r', out=[1 0 0];
0064 case 'g', out=[0 1 0];
0065 case 'b', out=[0 0 1];
0066 case 'y', out=[1 1 0];
0067 case 'm', out=[1 0 1];
0068 case 'c', out=[0 1 1];
0069 otherwise
0070     warning(['Unrecognised colour "' in '", black assumed'])
0071     out=[0 0 0];
0072     return;
0073 end
0074 
0075 function out=translatecolorstring(in)
0076 args.tokens=rgb_parse(in);
0077 args.N=length(args.tokens);
0078 if args.N>3 warning('Too many words in color description, any more than 3 will be ignored'); end
0079 while(args.N<3)
0080     args.tokens=[{'normal'};args.tokens];
0081     args.N=args.N+1;
0082 end
0083 
0084 cols=get_cols;
0085 col=[];
0086 for n=1:size(cols,1)
0087     names=cols{n,1};
0088     for m=1:length(names)
0089         if strcmp(args.tokens{3},names{m}) col=cols{n,2}; break; end
0090     end
0091     if ~isempty(col) break; end
0092 end
0093 
0094 if isempty(col)
0095     warning(['Unrecognised colour "' args.tokens{3} '", black assumed'])
0096     out=[0 0 0];
0097     return;
0098 end
0099 
0100 switch args.tokens{1}
0101 case 'slightly', fac=0.75;
0102 case 'normal', fac=0.5;
0103 case 'very', fac=0.25;
0104 case 'extremely', fac=0.125;
0105 otherwise
0106     warning(['Unrecognised modifier "' args.tokens{1} '", normal assumed'])
0107     fac=0.5;
0108 end
0109 
0110 switch args.tokens{2}
0111 case {'light','pale'}, out=1-(1-col)*fac;
0112 case 'normal', out=col;
0113 case 'dark', out=col*fac;
0114 otherwise
0115     warning(['Unrecognised descriptor "' args.tokens{2} '", normal assumed'])
0116     out=col;
0117 end
0118 
0119 function out=translatecolorRGB(in)
0120 
0121 BGR=0;
0122 if in<0
0123     in=-in;
0124     BGR=1;
0125 end
0126 
0127 b=bytes4(in);
0128 if BGR out=b(4:-1:2); else out=b(2:4); end
0129 
0130 function out=qbcolor(in)
0131 
0132 % rgb value from basic colour code
0133 % 0-7 are normal, 8-15 are bright
0134 % 0 - black
0135 % 1 - red,  2 - green,   3 - blue
0136 % 4 - cyan, 5 - magenta, 6 - yellow
0137 % 7 - white
0138 
0139 bright=0.5;
0140 if in>7 in=in-8; bright=1; end
0141 
0142 switch in
0143 case 0, rgb=[0 0 0];
0144 case 1, rgb=[1 0 0];
0145 case 2, rgb=[0 1 0];
0146 case 3, rgb=[0 0 1];
0147 case 4, rgb=[0 1 1];
0148 case 5, rgb=[1 0 1];
0149 case 6, rgb=[1 1 0];
0150 case 7, rgb=[1 1 1];
0151 otherwise
0152     warning('Unrecognised QBasic color, black assumed');
0153     out=[0 0 0];
0154     return;
0155 end
0156 
0157 out=rgb*bright;
0158 
0159 
0160 function tokens=rgb_parse(str)
0161 
0162 % parse string to obtain all tokens
0163 % quoted strings count as single tokens
0164 
0165 inquotes=0;
0166 intoken=0;
0167 pos=1;
0168 l=length(str);
0169 st=0;
0170 ed=0;
0171 token='';
0172 tab=char(9);
0173 tokens=cell(0);
0174 while(pos<=l)
0175     ch=str(pos);
0176     if inquotes
0177         if ch=='"'
0178             inquotes=0;
0179             tokens={tokens{:} token};
0180         else
0181             token=[token ch];
0182         end
0183     elseif intoken
0184         if ch==' ' | ch==tab
0185             intoken=0;
0186             tokens={tokens{:} token};
0187         elseif ch=='"'
0188             error(['Quote misplace in <' str '>']);
0189         else
0190             token=[token ch];
0191         end
0192     else
0193         if ch==' ' | ch==tab
0194             % do nothing
0195         elseif ch=='"'
0196             token='';
0197             inquotes=1;
0198         else
0199             token=ch;
0200             intoken=1;
0201         end
0202     end
0203     pos=pos+1;
0204 end
0205 
0206 if intoken tokens={tokens{:} token}; end
0207 if inquotes error(['Unpaired quotes in <' str '>']); end
0208 
0209 tokens=tokens';

0243 height=9;
0244 x=0;
0245 y=0;
0246 for n=1:length(cols)
0247     rect(x,y,cols{n})
0248     y=y+1;
0249     if y==height
0250         x=x+2;
0251         y=0;
0252     end
0253 end
0254 if y==0 x=x-2; end
0255 axis([0 (x+2) 0 height])
0256 title('names on different rows are alternates')

0258 function rect(x,y,col)
0259 if isempty(col) return; end
0260 r=rectangle('position',[x+0.1 y+0.1 1.8 0.8]);
0261 col_=col;
0262 if iscell(col) col=col{1}; end
0263 colrgb=rgb(col);
0264 if strcmp(col(1),'u') & length(col)==2
0265     t=text(x+1,y+0.5,{'unnamed',['colour (' col(2) ')']});
0266     set(r,'facecolor',colrgb);
0267 else
0268     t=text(x+1,y+0.5,col_);
0269     set(r,'facecolor',colrgb);
0270     if sum(colrgb)<1.5 set(t,'color',[1 1 1]); end
0271 end
0272 set(t,'horizontalalignment','center')
0273 set(t,'fontsize',10)

0275 function rgb_list
0276 cols=get_cols;
0277 disp(' ')
0278 for n=1:size(cols,1)
0279     code=cols{n,2};
0280     str=cols{n,1};
0281     str_=[];
0282     for m=1:length(str)
0283         str_=[str_ str{m} ', '];
0284     end
0285     str_=str_(1:end-2);
0286     if strcmp(str_(1),'u') & length(str_)==2
0287         str_=['* (' str_(2) ')'];
0288     end
0289     disp(['  [' sprintf('%.1f  %.1f  %.1f',code) '] - ' str_])
0290 end
0291 disp([10 '* colours marked thus are not named - if you know their' 10 '  designation, or if you feel sure a colour is mis-named,' 10 '  email me (address via help) or comment at' 10 '  www.mathworks.com/matlabcentral - "rgb demo" to see them' 10])

0329 % converts a DWORD into a four byte row vector
0330 function out=bytes4(in)
0331 
0332 out=[0 0 0 0];
0333 if in<0 | in>(2^32-1)
0334     warning('DWORD out of range, zero assumed');
0335     return;
0336 end
0337 
0338 N=4;
0339 while(in>0)
0340     out(N)=mod(in,256);
0341     in=(in-out(N))/256;
0342     N=N-1;
0343 end
